page.title: 08THE KINGSCLERE STREAM
page.content: The Kingsclere stream starts at the foot of the Downs where little springs bubble out of the ground. Then it makes a lake. At the end two streams flow out. One goes to a disused mill called Gailey mill; the water is very clear here. Then this joins the main stream. Then the stream goes under a road. A lot of ducks swim there, and many people bring their children to feed them. This place is known as 'the Ducks.' The stream flows through the village and behind the church. Here there is a lake with a bridge and a footpath. In the lake is an island where the ducks make their nests. In spring thousands of snowdrops grow on the island. Then the stream flows through a disused mill, and through some meadows. There were four mills for grinding corn. My brother caught a trout, and I have seen kingfishers.
